item.title: US Lawmakers Introduce Congressional Resolution to Terminate Trump-Era Tariffs on India
item.description: Top News US Lawmakers Introduce Congressional Resolution to Terminate Trump-Era Tariffs on India 1 day ago A resolution has been introduced in the US Congress to terminate tariffs imposed on India during Donald Trump's presidency. This legislative effort aims to reshape trade relations between the United States and India by addressing existing trade barriers. The resolution's introduction marks a significant step towards potentially modifying the current tariff structure affecting bilateral trade between the two nations.

item.title: Coforge Limited Allots 1,45,189 Shares Under ESOP Scheme, Paid-Up Capital Rises to ₹67.01 Crores
item.description: Coforge Limited Allots 1,45,189 Shares Under ESOP Scheme, Paid-Up Capital Rises to ₹67.01 Crores 4 hours ago Coforge Limited has allotted 1,45,189 equity shares under its ESOP 2005 scheme on December 14, 2025, with each share having a face value of ₹2.00. This allotment has increased the company's total paid-up share capital to 33,50,41,808 equity shares, aggregating to ₹67,00,83,616. The company is completing formalities for listing and trading of these shares on stock exchanges.

item.title: Market Wrap: Nifty and Sensex Climb Over 0.5% in Positive Close
item.description: Market Wrap: Nifty and Sensex Climb Over 0.5% in Positive Close 1 day ago Indian markets closed positively on December 12, with Nifty 50 breaching 26,000 and Sensex surpassing 85,000. The session saw a broad-based rally with 61% of traded stocks advancing. InterGlobe Aviation clarified no SEBI investigation and disclosed a CGST penalty. Infosys witnessed significant promoter share sales.

item.title: Ashoka Buildcon Secures ₹1,041.44 Crore BMC Flyover Project Through Joint Venture
item.description: Ashoka Buildcon Secures ₹1,041.44 Crore BMC Flyover Project Through Joint Venture 1 hour ago Ashoka Buildcon Limited, in a joint venture with Aakshaya Infra Projects Private Limited, has been awarded a ₹1,041.44 crore contract by Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) for the construction of a flyover connecting J.J. Bridge and Sitaram Selam Bridge in Mumbai. The project, to be executed over 24 months, aims to improve traffic connectivity in the E Ward area. Ashoka Buildcon holds a 51% stake in the joint venture, with Aakshaya Infra Projects holding the remaining 49%.
